title: Lecture: In a Cloud, in a Wall, in a Chair: Six Modernists in Mexico at Midcentury
title_display: Lecture: In a Cloud, in a Wall, in a Chair—Six Modernists in Mexico at Midcentury
hero_caption: Clara Porset. Butaque, about 1955–56. Gálvez Guzzy Family/Casa Gálvez Collection. Photo by Rodrigo Chapa.
short_description: Join educator Paula Santos to experience this groundbreaking exhibition before it closes. Santos introduces the work of Clara Porset, Lola Álvarez Bravo, Anni Albers, Ruth Asawa, Cynthia Sargent, and Sheila Hicks, shown for the first time together in this exhibition, and discusses how each of these artists breached disciplinary boundaries and national divides with their work.
description:
Join educator Paula Santos to experience this groundbreaking exhibition before it closes. Santos introduces the work of Clara Porset, Lola Álvarez Bravo, Anni Albers, Ruth Asawa, Cynthia Sargent, and Sheila Hicks, shown for the first time together in this exhibition, and discusses how each of these artists breached disciplinary boundaries and national divides with their work.
